name: Pingdom
activity_markdown: PyPI's infrastructure volunteers use Pingdom to monitor and receive alerts about downtime and other issues affecting end-users.

name: Sentry
activity_markdown: The PyPI team uses Sentry to capture, record, and respond to exceptions and errors on PyPI.

name: AWS
activity_markdown: PyPI uses AWS infrastructure to host the machines that power our services, serve DNS, host our databases, and send and monitor email.

name: Datadog
activity_markdown: PyPI uses Datadog to collect metrics from the applications, services, and infrastructure behind the scenes allowing for the team to measure the impact of new changes, monitor for problems, and alert when systems fail.

name: Fastly
activity_markdown: PyPI uses Fastly's CDN to quickly serve content to end-users, allowing us to minimize our hosting infrastructure and obscure possible downtime.

name: DigiCert
activity_markdown: PyPI uses Digicert to secure communication and prove identity with an EV Certificate.

name: StatusPage
activity_markdown: The PyPI team uses StatusPage to communicate downtime, service degradation, or maintenance windows to end-users.

name: Mozilla
activity_markdown:
In late 2017 the Python Software Foundation was awarded a Mozilla Open Source Support (MOSS) award.

This award was used to move PyPI from its legacy codebase and deploy Warehouse - the new codebase powering PyPI.

name: Open Technology Fund
activity_markdown:
In 2019 the Python Software Foundation was awarded a contract through the OTF Core Infrastructure Fund.

This contract included an audit and improvements to the accessibility of PyPI, internationalization and translations for PyPI user interface, and security features including two-factor authentication and API tokens for uploads.
